meanings.definition: To cut or pierce with a jagged edge.
meanings.sent1: She was jagging the paper with scissors.
meanings.sent2: The knife jagged the fabric as she cut it.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally started jagging the wrapping paper in a zigzag pattern.
meanings.sent4: The jagging teeth of the saw tore through the wood effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The jagging motion of the blade created a unique design on the leather.

meanings.sent1: The rock had a dangerous jagging sticking out.
meanings.sent2: Be careful of the jagging on that metal fence.
meanings.sent3: The jagging on the edge of the table caught her sweater.
meanings.sent4: The jagging of the thorn scratched his arm.
meanings.sent5: The jagging of the broken glass made it unsafe to touch.

meanings.definition: A sudden sharp pain or pang.
meanings.sent1: She winced at the sudden jagging in her side.
meanings.sent2: The jagging in his tooth made him call the dentist.
meanings.sent3: The jagging of hunger hit him right before dinner.
meanings.sent4: The jagging of regret pierced his heart.
meanings.sent5: The jagging of disappointment was evident in her expression.
